title: How to Make Wire Stitch Markers

steps.headline: Start with a spool of craft wire or straighten a paper clip or two.
steps.description: Any small paper clip will do, whether or not it is plastic coated, as long as it is made of wire. Craft wire, if you have it, is a little softer and easier to work.

steps.headline: Grip the very end of the wire in the pliers.
steps.description: Loop the end of the wire closely around the tip of the pliers.

steps.headline: Grip the wire just past the loop you just formed and fold it over the other way.
Grip the wire and turn it one more time.
steps.description: This time, grip it higher up and turn it a little more loosely.

steps.headline: Curl the wire out a little at the loose end.
Cut the wire off where you want it, generally a bit past the bottom of the second loop.
steps.description: Many pliers have a wire cutting edge like these do.

steps.headline: Curl the wire back toward itself.
steps.description: This will help when inserting the marker and it will help keep the marker from catching things.

tyn: Means of cutting the wire. Many pliers have a wire cutting edge built in, near the hinge.
